com.hoddmimes.tcpip

Class TcpIpClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hoddmimes.tcpip.TcpIpClient

  • public class TcpIpClient
extends java.lang.Object
    The TcpIpClient allows programs to create a connection to a server. After successfully established the connection the program can receive and send messages to the server.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      TcpIpClient()

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public static TcpIpConnectionInterface connect(java.lang.String pHost,
                                               int pPort,
                                               TcpIpConnectionCallbackInterface pCallback)
                                        throws java.io.IOException,
                                               IncompatibleConnectionException
        Simple constructor for creating a connection to a server.
        Parameters:
        pHost - Ip host address, either a IP host number (xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx) or a host name (foo.bar.com)
        pPort - the tcp/ip port on which the server will accept inbound connections on
        pCallback - interface to be called when messages from the server has been read or to signal communication error
        Returns:
        handle to the connection
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - error exception when failing to create and establish connection
        IncompatibleConnectionException - thrown when connecting to a server being started to accept s specific features i.e. plain, compressed, encrypted or eompressed_encrypted connections.

      • connect

        public static TcpIpConnectionInterface connect(TcpIpConnectionTypes pConnectionType,
                                               java.lang.String pHost,
                                               int pPort,
                                               TcpIpConnectionCallbackInterface pCallback)
                                        throws java.io.IOException,
                                               IncompatibleConnectionException
        Constructor for creating a connection to a server.
        Parameters:
        pConnectionType - type of connection. TcpIpConnectionTypes
        pHost - Ip host address, either a IP host number (xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx) or a host name (foo.bar.com)
        pPort - the tcp/ip port on which the server will accept inbound connections on
        pCallback - interface to be called when messages from the server has been read or to signal communication error
        Returns:
        handle to the connection
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - error exception when failing to create and establish connection
        IncompatibleConnectionException - thrown when connecting to a server being started to accept s specific features i.e. plain, compressed, encrypted or eompressed_encrypted connections.
